intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. boscii, commonly known as the Bosci's tawny vetch, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and North Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. This subspecies is notable for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
